channel.title: Virtual Mouse around an applet
channel.description: Can someone explain to me how this works (Cherokee for example) like in steps, so I can try and create one my self. I want no code, I just want a clear explanation of how it works :). Thanks.

item.description:

Umm, iirc, you write for Cherokee, Cherokee does not write for your Applet LoL

item.title: Virtual Mouse around an applet
item.dc:creator: @cnr_sport1 cnr sport1
item.description:
@cnr_sport1 wrote:

Pwnd:

Why wouldn’t you just use Cherokee if you’re going to copy all of the files?

Now, I’m trying to use cherokee but I can’t figure out how to get it to work on my applet.

People who read the first post, I got that from the nice fella named abraham2119 Can anyone give me a short explaination on how to setup cherokee to work with my applet?
Thanks.

item.title: Virtual Mouse around an applet
item.dc:creator: @cnr_sport1 cnr sport1
item.description:
@cnr_sport1 wrote:

I tried taking a look at cherokee, I copied every cherokee file except the BCEL ones to my runescape loader, and I am trying to figure out what to do next. I made AccSetup.java, which implements AccessorMethods. Then I made MouseSetup.java which implements Setup. Thats what the readme said to do, can you explain what I should do next. I didn’t really understand the read me.

I don’t know if this will help you understand what I have tried…


	public Applet app;
	public JPanel theGame;
	public Bot bots;

	   private Applet appletInstance;
	    private Dimension appletSize;
	    private AccessorMethods ac;
	
	
	public void loadFirst(Bot bot) {
			LoaderRS lr = new LoaderRS();
		        this.bots = bot;
		        theGame = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
			theGame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(768, 560));
			setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
			setSize(768, 556);
		//guuii shizzle :)
			app = lr.getApplet();//returns the applet whichis runescape
			app.init();
			app.start();
			theGame.add(app);
			
			getContentPane().add(theGame, BorderLayout.CENTER);
                        setupShit();
		public void setupShit() {
		 try {
	            Setup setup = ((Setup) Class.forName("bin/event/mouse/MouseSetup").newInstance());
	            
	            appletInstance = setup.getAppletInstance();
	            appletSize = setup.getAppletDimension();
	            ac = setup.getAccessorMethods();
	        } catch (Exception e) {
	            System.out.println("Setup class does not exist in the classpath, exiting...");
	            e.printStackTrace();
	            return;
	        }
	}

I also have that, which tells me it cant find the class…

I’m all over the place lol

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse around an applet
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Basically, it constructs MouseEvents to send to the applet. In practice it’s much more difficult because there are also Focus events, and many different kinds of Mouse events as well, also the inevitable Key events.

Honestly, why not just look at the source code to cherokee? It’s probably simpler than having someone explain it to you here. Although I’m happy to help you out with anything you need clarification on.

Read full topic
